009package Ch17_EdgePreservingSmoothing;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.addToDialog;
012import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.getFromDialog;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralF.Parameters;
020import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralFilterScalar;
021import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralFilterScalarSeparable;
022import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralFilterVector;
023import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralFilterVectorSeparable;
024import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
025import imagingbook.common.ij.IjProgressBarMonitor;
026import imagingbook.common.util.progress.ProgressMonitor;
027
028/**
029 * This plugin demonstrates the use of the (full) BilateralFilter class. This
030 * plugin works for all types of images. Given a color image, the filter is
031 * applied separately to each color component if {@code UseScalarFilter} is set
032 * true. Otherwise a vector filter is applied, using the specified color norm.
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/03/30
036 */
037public class Bilateral_Filter implements PlugInFilter {
038        
039        private static Parameters params = new Parameters();
040        private static boolean UseSeparableFilter = false;
041        private static boolean UseScalarFilter = false;
042        
043        private boolean isColor;
044        
045        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus imp) {
046                return DOES_ALL;
047        }
048        
049        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
050                isColor = (ip instanceof ColorProcessor);
051                if (!getParameters())
052                        return;
053                
054                GenericFilter filter = null;    
055                if (isColor && !UseScalarFilter) {      // use a vector filter
056                        filter = (UseSeparableFilter) ? 
057                                        new BilateralFilterVectorSeparable(params) : 
058                                        new BilateralFilterVector(params);
059                }
060                else {                                                                  // use a scalar filter
061                        filter = (UseSeparableFilter) ? 
062                                        new BilateralFilterScalarSeparable(params) : 
063                                        new BilateralFilterScalar(params);
064                }
065                
066                try (ProgressMonitor m = new IjProgressBarMonitor(filter)) {
067                        filter.applyTo(ip);
068                }
069        }
070                
071        private boolean getParameters() {
072                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
073                addToDialog(params, gd);
074                gd.addCheckbox("Use scalar filters (color only)", UseScalarFilter);
075                gd.addCheckbox("Use X/Y-separable filter", UseSeparableFilter);
076                
077                gd.showDialog();
078                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
079                        return false;
080                
081                getFromDialog(params, gd);
082                UseScalarFilter = gd.getNextBoolean();
083                UseSeparableFilter = gd.getNextBoolean();
084                
085                params.sigmaD = Math.max(params.sigmaD, 0.5);
086                params.sigmaR = Math.max(params.sigmaR, 1);
087                return params.validate();
088    }
089}
090
091
